description: Added enhanced toFormData implementation with additional options
Added enhanced toFormData implementation with additional options (unlikely breaking change)
Removed incorrect argument for NetworkError constructor

Axiom v1.x conflicts with Jest.
This can only be breaking if you are using jest to run your tests.
This is due to jest not supporting the `exports` field in the package.json (see [jest issue](https://github.com/facebook/jest/issues/9771)).
Instead of waiting for `resolve` to support the `exports` field (see [resolve issue](https://github.com/browserify/resolve/issues/222)) there are some things you can try yourself to be able to use axiom v1.x:
(1) If possible, update jest to version >29.2.1 (see [comment proposing solution](https://github.com/axios/axios/issues/5026#issuecomment-1288528794))
(2) Add `--transformIgnorePatterns \"node_modules/(?!axios)/\""` as an inline argument to the jest script in the package.json (see [comment proposing solution](https://github.com/axios/axios/issues/5026#issuecomment-1271194848))
(3) Add `transformIgnorePatterns: ['/node_modules/(?!(axios)/)']` to the jest config, either in the `jest.config.js` or you can add this to the `package.json` directly under the `jest` field (see [comment proposing solution](https://github.com/axios/axios/issues/5026#issuecomment-1271953176))
(4) Adding `'^axios$': require.resolve('axios'),` to the [moduleNameMapper](https://jestjs.io/docs/configuration#modulenamemapper-objectstring-string--arraystring) configuration in jest. Again either in `jest.config.js` or `package.json`. Potentially combine this with solution 5 (see [comment proposing solution](https://github.com/axios/axios/issues/5101#issuecomment-1276572468))
(5) If nothing else has helped, try upgrading to `axios@1.2.0-alpha.1`. (see [comment proposing solution](https://github.com/axios/axios/issues/5026#issuecomment-1310793004))
